title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text: This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita in the Gapminder dataset over time.

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text: This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita in the Gapminder dataset over time.

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
Load data
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
gap = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”) gap.head()
years = sorted(gap[“year”].unique())
plt.figure() for yr in years: d = gap[gap[“year”] == yr] plt.scatter(d[“gdp_per_capita”], d[“life_expectancy”], label=str(yr), alpha=0.4)
plt.title(“Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita (1952–2007)”) plt.xlabel(“GDP per Capita”) plt.ylabel(“Life Expectancy”) plt.xscale(“log”) plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc=“upper left”, title=“Year”) plt.tight_layout() plt.show()

title: Country Analysis
text: This page analyzes how life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population change over time for a single country in the Gapminder dataset.

title: Country Analysis
text: This page analyzes how life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population change over time for a single country in the Gapminder dataset.

title: Country Analysis
text:
Load data
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
gap = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”) gap.head()
country = “United States” country_data = gap[gap[“country”] == country].sort_values(“year”)
country_data[[“country”,“year”,“life_expectancy”,“gdp_per_capita”,“population_millions”]].head()
years = country_data[“year”]
plt.figure() plt.plot(years, country_data[“life_expectancy”], marker=“o”) plt.title(f”Life Expectancy Over Time — {country}“) plt.xlabel(”Year”) plt.ylabel(“Life Expectancy”) plt.show()
plt.figure() plt.plot(years, country_data[“gdp_per_capita”], marker=“o”) plt.title(f”GDP per Capita Over Time — {country}“) plt.xlabel(”Year”) plt.ylabel(“GDP per Capita”) plt.show()
plt.figure() plt.plot(years, country_data[“population_millions”], marker=“o”) plt.title(f”Population Over Time — {country}“) plt.xlabel(”Year”) plt.ylabel(“Population (millions)”) plt.show()

title: Gapminder Website
text:
The Gapminder dataset contains information on life expectancy, population, and GDP per capita for 142 countries from 1952 to 2007 at 5-year intervals.

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text: This page analyzes the relationship between life expectancy and population (in millions) across countries and over time in the Gapminder dataset.

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text: This page analyzes the relationship between life expectancy and population (in millions) across countries and over time in the Gapminder dataset.

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
Load data
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
gap = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”) gap.head()
years = sorted(gap[“year”].unique())
plt.figure() for yr in years: d = gap[gap[“year”] == yr] plt.scatter(d[“population_millions”], d[“life_expectancy”], label=str(yr), alpha=0.4)
plt.title(“Life Expectancy vs Population (1952–2007)”) plt.xlabel(“Population (millions)”) plt.ylabel(“Life Expectancy”) plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc=“upper left”, title=“Year”) plt.tight_layout() plt.show()
